Confirmed Third Floor or Central Library to be rented out as "enterprise centre".
Gate Library reopens after refurb inc. café, wifi, community space and digital displays.
Maindee and Carnegie Library may close, Central Library service will reduce from two floors to one (with combined museum/library staff): £103k cut 2016/17. Decision on June 8th.

North Yorkshire - Original cut of £4.23m reduced by £175k. Libraries to be in 3 tiers: (1) "core" (the 7 biggest Harrogate, Malton, Northallerton, Richmond, Scarborough, Selby and Skipton) will retain 60% paid staff (with rest hoped to be made up by volunteers) / (2) "hybrid" (Filey, Knaresborough, Pickering, Ripon, and Whitby) will retain 40% paid staff (with rest taken up by volunteers) / (3) "community-managed" will receive bookstock and IT bit will be split into two with "highest performing" ( Catterick; Colburn; Crosshills; Easingwold; Eastfield; Sherburn; Stokesley and Thirsk) with 12-15 hours of one paid library worker per week and rest ( Bedale, Bentham, Boroughbridge,  Helmsley, Ingleton, Kirkbymoorside, Leyburn, Norton, Pateley Bridge, Scalby, Settle, Starbeck and Tadcaster ) will get one paid library worker for 5-7 hours per week . To be confirmed 7th July.
Ventnor to become volunteer, with one paid (23 per hours) paid worker if town council agrees to pay running costs.

Libraries may become part of Wellbeing Community Interest Company along with other council services and those currently run by Northamptonshire Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust and the University of Northampton (inc. dieticians, smoking cessation advisors, befrienders and debt advisors).
Brynmawr Library will close, with service being moved to adult learning centre. Town council contributes £4k to £20k cost for move.
Confirmed Hawarden, Mancot and Queensferry will close.
Confirmed Maindee and Carnegie will close, Central will be reduced 9 full-time posts lost.
Caister Library loses paid library staff: now run entirely by Heritage Centre staff and volunteers.
North Kensington Library to move to Lancaster Youth Centre, with old site being commercially leased.
Volunteer library issues halved (down 46%) since leaving council control.
4 libraries – Bob Lawrence, Hatch End, Rayners Lane and North Harrow libraries  – closed on June 13th.

2 libraries leave council control: Craven Arms passed to Shropshire Furniture Scheme and Highley passed to Halo Leisure. 5 more libraries to be passed: Bishop’s Castle Library to Enterprise South West Shropshire, Broseley Library to Broseley Town Council, Shifnal Library to Shifnal Town Council,  Cleobury Mortimer Library to the Cleobury Country organisation and  Church Stretton Library to South Shropshire Academy. Council wishes also to transfer away Albrighton, Bayston Hill, Gobowen, Ellesmere, Much Wenlock, Pontesbury, Shawbury and Wem.
£16m collocated leisure centre/heritage/health/library planned for Great Sankey.

Sixteen libraries (Abbeyview, Bowhill, Colinsburgh, Crail, Crossgates, East Wemyss, Falkland, Freuchie,, Glenwood, Kinghorn, Lundin Links, Markinch, Pittenweem, Pitteuchar, Thornton, and Townhill) may close over three years.
Hampshire - Plans to move Emsworth Library into community centre cancelled.
Volunteer library at Blurton Community Centre to replace lost mobile library stop.
Shipley Library will have £640k refurbishment inc. self-service machines, new exhibition area, heating, toilets.
Cradley Library may move into new building due to area redevelopment.
Move to libraries being run by a Trust delayed.
Ownership of Lingfield Library passed to community trust.  Paid staff will remain for one year while negotiations with council continue.
Public consultation brought forward due to protests over proposed cuts.
Cambridgeshire – Kora business centre cancelled due to council concerns over due diligence.
Enfield – Mobile library confirmed to be closed. 11 libraries to be "community" sharing buildings with other services.
Cross Hands Library will temporarily move into cinema and then co-locate, probably with police station.
£227k staffing budget cut. Reigate opening hours increase with introduction of self-service. Other libraries will see opening hours change.
Burbage Library may be run by a local brewery as an alternative to it closing.
Cuts to library opening hours from July 6th, voluntary redundancies.
